revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - Fine. Before finalising, please add the name of contributor at the end of the commentary (and proofread).
Vote - AcceptText - This commentary is more appropriate than regularizing the text, I feel.
Submit - Added a commentary on l. 1.

General - In l. 1, (ὑπέρ) is to be read as διά --> δέδωκεν Ἀπολλῶς Διοσκόρου διὰ Φοιβάμμωνος. The writer clearly wrote (ὑπέρ). It cannot, however, be doubted that the document requires διά at that position, noting followed by the name of the actual payer of the amount due from the onoma (i.e., the fiscal account) of Apollos. The ll. 3–4 imply that the writer copied the information from a register (or from the original receipt), and he may have simply misread the original δ(ιά) as (ὑπέρ), as both might look similar when fluently/rashly/carelessly written.
Submit - Entered BL corrections for ll. 1 and 4.
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek; tagged num rend=fraction
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)

div.ab:
δέδωκεν Ἀπολλῶς Διοσκόρουδέδωκεν ὄνομα ως Διοσκόρου ὑπὲρ Φοιβάμμωνος
ὑπὲρ διαγραφῆς β ἰνδικτίονος χρυσοῦ κεράτια τρία ἥμισυ, γίνεται κεράτια γ 𐅵 μόνα,
καὶ ἑτοίμως ἔχω ἐνεγκεῖν σοι ἐντάγιον τοῦ ὑποδέκτου τῆς
πόλεως καὶ ἀναλαβεῖν τὸ ἐμόν. Πέτρος διαστολεὺςδι στοιχεῖ μοι.

item.p: In l. 1, (ὑπέρ) is to be read as διά. While the writer clearly wrote (ὑπέρ) on the papyrus, it cannot be doubted that the document requires διά at that position. It introduces the name of the actual payer of the amount due from the onoma (i.e., the fiscal account) of Apollos, son of Dioskoros; see P.Lond. 5.1665.1, SB 20.15013.1 and 4, SB 20.15015.6, SB 24.15975.1, and SB 26.16523.1. The text later (ll. 3–4) implies that the writer copied the information from a register (or from the original receipt), and he may have simply misread the original δ(ιά) as (ὑπέρ), as both might look similar when written by a swift hand. [M. Stern]
